required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 177Lu-PSMA-EB-01 in Patients With Metastatic Castration-resistant Prostate Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Dosimetry of 177Lu-PSMA-EB-01 in Patients With Metastatic Castration-resistant Prostate Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This is a pilot study to assess the safety and measure image-based absorbed dose of 177Lu-PSMA-EB-01, a new PSMA-specific radiopharmaceutical, in patients with metastatic castration resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC) who will undergo radioligand therapy (RLT). All patients underwent 68Ga-PSMA and 18F-FDG PET/CT for selection and were randomly divided into three groups of 3 people each.The three groups received an approximately 1.11 GBq (30mCi), 1.85 GBq (50 mCi) and 2.59 GBq (70mCi) of 177Lu-PSMA-EB-01 up to 2 cycles, respectively.

detailed_description.textblock: Prostate cancer is the most frequent malignant tumor in men worldwide. Prostate-specific membrane antigen (PSMA), is a surface molecule specifically expressed by prostate tumors which was shown to be a valid target for radiotherapy. 177Lu-PSMA-617, a urea-based compound, provide an effective target for the treatment of metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer. However, a major problem in the therapeutic use of 177Lu-PSMA-617 has been its short half-life and fast rate of clearance. The investigators designed and synthesized a new radiopharmaceutical, named 177Lu-PSMA-EB-01. EB（Evans Blue）can bind to albumin to slow down its plasma clearance rate, thereby increasing tumor accumulation and reducing the total dosage of Lu-177. Hence, EB-PSMA-01 may be an option for consideration due to limited supply of Lu-177, by which more patients may be benefited by this version of 177Lu-EB-PSMA-01. This study was designed to investigate the safety, dosimetry and preliminary effects of 177Lu-EB-PSMA-01 in patients with metastatic castration resistant prostate cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Dosimetry of normal organs and tumors
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 4 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The semiquantitative dosimetry will be performed based on SPECT/CT acquisitions after the first administration of 177Lu-PSMA-EB-01. The dose delivered to normal organs and tumors will be recorded.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Hematologic status were performed before and every 2 weeks after administration of radiopharmaceutical. Adverse events were categorized using the Common Toxicity Criteria for Adverse Events 5.0

primary_outcome.measure: Hepatic and renal toxic events collection
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Liver function, and renal function were performed before and 4 weeks after administration of radiopharmaceutical. Adverse events were categorized using the Common Toxicity Criteria for Adverse Events 5.0.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: The serum PSA response was documented semimonthly until 6 weeks after the administration of 177Lu-PSMA-EB-01. PSA response was classified as the following: partial response (PR) if PSA decrease ≥50%, progressive disease (PD) if PSA increase ≥ 25% and stable disease (SD) if PSA increase <25% or PSA decrease <50%.

arm_group.description: All patients were intravenous injected with single dose 1.11 GBq (30 mCi) of 177Lu-PSMA-EB-01 then monitored at 3 hours, 24 hours, 48 hours, 72 hours, and 168 hours post-injection.
All patients were intravenous injected with single dose 1.85 GBq (50 mCi) of 177Lu-PSMA-EB-01 then monitored at 3 hours, 24 hours, 48 hours, 72 hours, and 168 hours post-injection.
All patients were intravenous injected with single dose 2.59 GBq (70 mCi) of 177Lu-PSMA-EB-01 then monitored at 3 hours, 24 hours, 48 hours, 72 hours, and 168 hours post-injection.

intervention.description: All patients were intravenous injected with single dose 1.11 GBq (30 mCi) of 177Lu-PSMA-EB-01 then monitored at 3 hours, 24 hours, 48 hours, 72 hours, and 168 hours post-injection.
All patients were intravenous injected with single dose 1.85 GBq (50 mCi) of 177Lu-PSMA-EB-01 then monitored at 3 hours, 24 hours, 48 hours, 72 hours, and 168 hours post-injection.
All patients were intravenous injected with single dose 2.59 GBq (70 mCi) of 177Lu-PSMA-EB-01 then monitored at 3 hours, 24 hours, 48 hours, 72 hours, and 168 hours post-injection.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- progressive metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer
- tumors with high PSMA expression confirmed on 68Ga-PSMA PET/CT
Exclusion Criteria:
- a serum creatinine level of more than 150 μmol per liter
- a hemoglobin level of less than 10.0 g/dl
- a white-cell count of less than 4.0× 109/L
- a platelet count of less than 100 × 109/L
- a total bilirubin level of more than 3 times the upper limit of the normal range
- a serum albumin level of more than 3.0 g per deciliter
- cardiac insufficiency
